location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.390 of 1854 from Captain Arnold Kemball, Resident in the Persian Gulf, to Henry Anderson, Secretary to the Government of Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter relates to a navigation chart of the Arab coast, which Kemball has received from Lieutenant Ferguson, the draughtsman of the Indian Navy. Kemball states that the chart describes the coast from Ras Mussendom [Musandam] to Ras el Hudd [Ra's al á¸¤add] in Oman, and is not yet published. Kemball discusses whether the utility of the map would be improved if Arabic place names were used in addition to the English, and refers to the recent incidents on shipwreck and plunder that have occured on this particular stretch of coast, including the Centaurin 1852.
